title: Vintage Gymnastics Stars
description: Flip through the pages of gymnastics history and remember the graceful athletes who performed breathtaking feats on the world stage!

questions.question: Which Romanian gymnast scored the first perfect 10.0 in Olympic history at the 1976 Montreal Games?
Nadia Comaneci's perfect 10 was scored on which apparatus?
The scoreboard at the 1976 Olympics famously displayed Nadia's perfect score as 1.00 because the scoreboard couldn't display what?
Which Soviet gymnast captivated audiences at the 1972 Munich Olympics with her daring performances, especially on the balance beam?
Soviet gymnast Larisa Latynina held the record for most Olympic medals of any athlete for 48 years. How many total medals did she win?
Mary Lou Retton became the first American woman to win the Olympic all-around gold medal at which Games?
Mary Lou Retton needed a perfect 10 on her final event to win the gold medal. Which apparatus was it?
Which Japanese gymnast won gold in the men's all-around at three consecutive Olympics (1960, 1964, 1968)?
Olga Korbut performed a daring backflip on the uneven bars at the 1972 Olympics. What was this move later called?
Which country dominated men's gymnastics at the Olympic level from 1960 through 1976, winning the team gold five times in a row?
Bela Karolyi, the famous gymnastics coach, trained both Nadia Comaneci and Mary Lou Retton. From which country did he originally come?
The balance beam, one of the most challenging gymnastics apparatus, is how wide?
Which American male gymnast won two gold medals at the 1984 Olympics, including the all-around?
Vera Caslavska, who won seven Olympic gold medals, was a gymnast from which country that made a political statement at the 1968 Olympics?
After the 1976 Olympics, the popularity of gymnastics soared in the United States, leading to a boom in what type of facility across the country?
